description:
See more in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCZHp4d1HnItSSUpA-DskfKKKrQ_LQYwP - A proposed ruling to require customer rebates when local channels are pulled from a lineup may have implications for ATSC 3.0 encryption. Cable companies want reforms to retransmission fees and the broadcasters are firing back. See more like this: http://lon.tv/ww and subscribe! http://lon.tv/s

VIDEO INDEX:
00:00 - Intro
00:36 - FCC Docket on Broadcast Blackout Rebates
02:20 - Verizon & Cable Industry Response
03:34 - Dish's Response and Retransmission Reform
06:54 - Broadcaster's Response
08:20 - My Thoughts
09:05 - ATSC 3.0 Docket - http://lon.tv/fccinstructions
09:48 - Conclusion

title: FCC Docket Gets Wild : Broadcasters vs. Cable Companies Over Retransmission Fees
